lead_paragraph: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions.

headline.main: Making Olympic Boxing Safer by Eliminating Head Guards

snippet: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions....
abstract: Male boxers competing in Rio Olympics will do so without protective headgear for first time based on argument that they will be safer without it; several studies, including one commissioned by International Boxing Assn, argue that number of acute brain injuries actually declined when head guards were not in use; critics of decision say findings are suspect, and decision has more to do with drawing in fans than keeping boxers safe.
